This game is pretty old, maybe writing the review now would prove to be redundant but meh I'll do it anyway.

I finished the game in approximately 9 hours. Which is quite longer than most players probably since I'm not exactly smart at these kinds of puzzle games. But that doesn't mean the game made me bored af. The game entertains you in lots of ways. Both from the actual game mechanics and from the snappy retort that Wheatley and GLaDOS spew out without reserve. I don't know if this game is actually comedic but it has some points for giggles, yeah, you'll laugh at yourself for not realizing to put that portal there sooner, or you should place that cube on the button first and then jump, you idiot.

The game's physics and mechanics are awesome, the way it made you fly and stuff, I love it. This game is pretty simple if you ask me, but there are so much combination of stuff going on in one test chamber you need to exploit all these simple things.The puzzle could get tiring somewhat if you have sat for hours without knowing what to do, but in the end you will ALWAYS figure it out. 

There are some test chambers that, when you took your first step in, you'd think to yourself 'what the hell there are so many things going on, what am I supposed to do', and thats why I think the best way of solvng all the puzzle inside this game is through the process of elimination. Try out everything that seems viable and you'll get the answer, eventually.

If you are into puzzle games, I'd definitely recommend this game. 

Oh yeah did I mention you can make your own test chamber and screw yourself up? yeah you can do that.

[u] [b] Positives: [/b] [/u]
+	Portalâ€™s setting is fleshed out with some amazing new characters and a larger perspective of the Aperture Science facility. The story is also more entertaining and has higher stakes than ever.
+	Many new gameplay elements expand the sandbox of the puzzles, and keep them unpredictable throughout the majority of the game.
+	Thereâ€™s an abundance of content due to Co-op and Community Created levels!

[u] [b] Negatives: [/b] [/u]
-	The beautiful, detailed environments sometimes compete for attention with the puzzles themselves, causing a few areas to be really confusing for no real reason.
(Ex: You enter an enormous cavern with impressive-looking puzzle locations all around you going into the distance, but after a long search for where to advance, you find that youâ€™re just supposed to leave through one of the ordinary little doors right next to you)

[u] [b] Overall: [/b] [/u]
If you enjoyed the first Portal then absolutely get Portal 2! It expands the gameplay and story in fascinating new directions, and is almost perfect in its execution!
